name: Says Something Else
author: Norman Yung

sections.description: Says Something Else replaces the default “SoAndSo says:” in WordPress comment threads with whatever you specify. If you specify more than one replacement, Says Something Else will randomly pick from your collection of specified words.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the extracted archive to ‘wp-content/plugins/’
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu
  3. Open the plugin settings page Settings -> Says Something Else
  4. Add/Edit replacement words
  5. Enjoy!
sections.faq:
I’ve found a bug, where do I report it?

The fastest way would be to leave a comment on the plugin homepage
sections.changelog:
• 1.0 Initial release
  • 1.0.1 Fixed bug by adding stripslashes to JS output.
  • 1.0.2 Removed empty() values from the replacement list on runtime.
